page.title: 19Heathland, Bridgham
page.content:
The Nature Conservancy Council, concerned about the loss of heathland (mostly to commercial farming) has recently taken over part of Brettenham and Bridgham heaths, part of the diminishing Norfolk Breckland. The Council will provide a continuing site and habitat for the varied native grasses, wild flowers, insects and birds and to ensure this, public access to the heath has been restricted. The sandy, heather covered wilds of the brecks are believed to have come about as a result of intense but short term farming practices, firstly by early farmers seeking easily worked soils and secondly by hungry sheep.
The ancient Peddars Way track crosses this area and is increasingly popular with walkers.
